snippet: The chief of a dismantled radical network in France was sentenced Friday to nine years in prison for recruiting for jihad and plotting attacks against Jewish sites.
abstract: French court sentences Mohamed Achamlane to nine years in prison for his work in heading up dismantled radical Islamic Forsane Alizza group, which had plotted attacks on kosher markets and other Jewish business in Paris; Achamlane was also accused of abducting and torturing Jewish judge in Lyon; other members of group are sentenced to up to six years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The chief of a dismantled radical network in France was sentenced Friday to nine years in prison for recruiting for jihad and plotting attacks against Jewish sites.

headline.main: France: Extremist Leader Gets 9 Years for Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Europe; France: Extremist Leader Gets 9 Years for Terrorism
